current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To establish, within the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, an integrated and
			 comprehensive ocean, coastal, Great Lakes, and atmospheric research and
			 environmental information sharing program to support renewable
			 energy, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Renewable Energy Environmental Research Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Renewable Energy Environmental Research Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

The purpose of this Act is to establish an
			 integrated and comprehensive ocean, coastal, Great Lakes, and atmospheric
			 research and environmental information sharing program to support
			 renewable energy.
In this Act:
The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Under Secretary for Oceans and Atmosphere
Administrator of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration

text.#text: The term

term.#tail:
means any form of renewable energy, including traditional hydropower, terrestrial renewable
			 energy, and renewable energy derived from the sea, such as
			 wave energy, tidal energy, ocean current energy, offshore wind energy,
			 salinity
			 gradient energy, ocean thermal gradient energy, and ocean thermal energy
			 conversion.

text.#text: The term
Not later than 3 years after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

to define requirements for a comprehensive
			 and integrated ocean, coastal, Great Lakes, and atmosphere science program
			 to
			 support renewable energy development in the United States based on a
			 review of scientific and industry
			 information;

to identify and describe current climate,
			 weather, and water data programs, products, services, and authorities
			 within
			 the

quote.#tail:
technology, including research to accurately quantify
			 the downstream micro-climate impacts of wind-power turbines;

text.#text:
to provide targeted research, data,
			 monitoring, observation, and other information, products, and services
			 concerning climate, weather, and water in support of renewable energy and

to reduce duplication and leverage the
			 resources of existing

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, including the atmospheric, ocean, and coastal observation
			 systems;

text.#text: other offices and programs within the

Federal, State, tribal, and local
			 observation systems; and

other entities, including the private
			 sector organizations and institutions of higher education;

to facilitate public-private cooperation,
			 including identification and assessment of current private sector
			 capabilities; and

to inform and educate the public and the private sector about the progress and findings of the
			 renewable research and development carried out pursuant to the plan.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall provide public notice and opportunity for 1 or more public hearings
			 and
			 shall seek comments from Federal and State agencies, tribes, local
			 governments,
			 representatives of the private sector, and other parties interested in
			 renewable energy observations, data, and use in order to improve

climate, weather, and water observation data products and services to more
			 effectively support renewable energy development.

text.#text: In developing the plan, the

header.#text:
Establishment of research, prediction, and
			 environmental information program

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall establish a program to
			 develop and implement an integrated and comprehensive ocean, coastal,
			 Great
			 Lakes, and atmosphere research and operations program, based on the plan
			 required by

, to support renewable energy development in the
			 United
			 States.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Renewable Energy Environmental Research Act of 2014/s:4

text.#text:
Not later than 3 years after the date of
			 the enactment of this Act, the

At a minimum, the program required by subsection (a) shall
			 include the following:

Improvements in coordinated climate,
			 weather, water research, biological and technological research monitoring,
			 and observations to support renewable energy siting and development.

quote.#tail:
technology to provide information and decision services in support of
			 renewable
			 energy development.

text.#text:
Coordinated weather, water, and climate
			 prediction capability focused on renewable energy and

Support for the transition to, and reliable
			 delivery of, sustained operational weather, water, and climate products
			 from
			 research, observation, and prediction outputs.

Means of identifying biological and
			 ecological effects of marine renewable energy development on living marine
			 resources, the marine and coastal environment, marine-dependent
			 industries, and
			 coastal communities.

Baseline ecological characterization,
			 including research, data collection, and mapping, of the coastal and
			 marine
			 environment and living marine resources for marine renewable energy
			 development.

Avoidance, minimization, and mitigation
			 strategies to address the potential impacts of renewable energy on
			 the
			 marine, coastal, and Great Lakes habitats resources and communities,
			 including developing
			 effective
			 monitoring protocols, use of adaptive management, informed engineering
			 design
			 and operating parameters, and the establishment of protocols for
			 minimizing the
			 environmental impacts of testing, developing, and deploying marine
			 renewable
			 energy devices.

Support for the development of marine
			 special area management plans by states as defined by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that would support renewable energy development
			 consistent with natural resource protection and other coastal-dependent
			 economic growth.

text.#text:
Coordination of comprehensive digital mapping, modeling,
			 and other geospatial information and services to support planning for
			 renewable
			 energy and stewardship of ecosystem and living marine ecosystems,
			 including
			 protected species, in ocean, Great Lakes, and coastal areas.

A coordinated approach for examining and
			 quantifying the micro-climate impacts of wind-power farms on soil
			 transpiration
			 and drying.

Provision for outreach to the public and
			 private sector about program research, information, and products,
			 including
			 making non-proprietary information and best management practices developed
			 under this program available to the public.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall consider this information when making
			 planning,
			 siting, and permitting decisions for renewable energy.

text.#text:
The program established under subsection
			 (a) shall be designed to collect, synthesize, and distribute data in a
			 manner
			 that can be used by resource managers responsible for making
			 decisions
			 about renewable energy projects. The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall seek appropriate opportunities to facilitate and
			 expand
			 cooperation with private sector entities to develop and expand information
			 services that serve the renewable energy industry.

text.#text:
To the extent
			 practicable, in implementing the program established under this section,
			 the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and not less frequently than once every 2 years
			 thereafter, the

text.#text: Not later than 2 years after the date on which the
Each report submitted under subsection (a) shall include the following:

A description of activities carried out
			 under this Act.

Recommendations for prioritization of
			 activities under this Act for fiscal years beginning after the date on
			 which
			 the report is submitted.

Funding levels for activities under this
			 Act in those fiscal years.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, in consultation with relevant
			 Federal
			 agencies, shall establish and maintain a renewable energy information
			 library and data
			 portal to function as a common, cross agency repository of data pertinent
			 to renewable energy development.

text.#text:
Not later than 3 years after the date of the

The library required by subsection (a)	shall include, at a minimum, the following:

Links to data and information products for

Links to planning and decision support
			 tools for use in renewable energy development.

Data about the baseline condition of ocean
			 and coastal resources.
